ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the adoption worker finalized the adoption of three children prior to
getting the Adoption Assistance agreements signed by all parties.
INVESTIGATION:
On September 15, 2020, a special investigation was initiated regarding the allegation
described above. Agency staff were interviewed. Documents were also reviewed.
What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
2

On September 16, 2020, a phone call was placed to the complainant and a voice
mail message left.
On September 16, 2020, the agency Chief Administrator was interviewed by
telephone. The Chief Administrator stated that she was aware of the problem and
acknowledged that the agency had failed to complete the required documents prior
to the finalization of the adoption. The Chief Administrator referred me to the
Program Supervisor for additional information.
On September 17, 2020, a video conference interview was conducted with the
agency Program Supervisor. She offered the following information. The adoption
finalization for Foster Child A occurred on July 9, 2020. The adoption assistance
agreement was not signed until July 23, 2020, resulting in the adoptive family not
being eligible for adoption assistance. The Program Supervisor reported that the
agency worker was new to adoption and had failed to get the required signatures
prior to finalization. The Program Supervisor reported that the agency was working
to correct the problem so the adoptive family could receive assistance. The Program
Supervisor submitted documents for my review.
On November 12, 2020, Staff 1, the agency adoption worker, was interviewed. Staff
1 confirmed that the adoption was finalized on July 9, 2020. Staff 1 reported that she
did not obtain the required signatures from the adoption subsidy office until July 23,
2020, post adoption finalization. Staff 1 reported that after she had received
information from the subsidy office that the adoptive parents were eligible for
assistance, she thought she then just needed to obtain the adoptive parent
signatures and the agreement would be valid. Staff 1 reported that she did not know
that the subsidy office needed to sign the agreement after the adoptive parents had
signed the agreement. Staff 1 reported that the problem has been resolved and the
adoptive parents are now receiving subsidy assistance.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
A DHHS – 4113 Adoption Assistance Agreement, was signed by the adoptive
parents and Staff 1 on July 1, 2020. The document was signed by the subsidy office
on July 23, 2020. The file documents that the adoption was finalized on July 9, 2020.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
AAM 200 ADOPTION ASSISTANCE ELIGIBILITY AND FUNDING
SOURCE DETERMINATION
Signed Agreement: A negotiated DHS-4113, Adoption
Assistance Agreement, must be signed by the adoptive
parent(s) and the MDHHS adoption and guardianship
assistance program manager or designee prior to the final order
of adoption.
ANALYSIS: The Chief Administrator, Program Supervisor, and Staff 1 all
acknowledged that the Adoption Assistance Agreement was
signed and completed after the finalization of the adoption.
The file indicates that the adoption was finalized on July 9, 2020
and the required agreement was signed and competed on July
23, 2020, post finalization of the adoption.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
